name: The Fairmont Olympic Seattle

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Fairmont Olympic was an excellent choice for my partner & I to spend a weekend in Seattle with. The hotel is elegant, tastefully decorated, but not overly stuffy. Staff are a pleasure to meet and treat you with utmost courtesy, anticipating needs. The location is near several excellent restaurants, tourist activities such as the Seattle Central Library, as well as the financial district for meetings. We will definitely be back, despite the high price tag.
reviews.title: Simply Extraordinary

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First off, the things I enjoyed about the hotel. It’s a less than 10 min walk to Pike Place Market and close to a ton of stores on Pine St. The room itself was room itself was comfortable and larger than the rooms at some other Fairmonts. We were a couple of doors down from the elevator, but it was quiet. The room included a kettle and Keurig machine with quality coffee and teas, along with a well-stocked mini bar. However, there were a couple of items in the mini bar that were beyond their expiration date. It also would have been nice if the fridge was larger to allow us to keep some of our own food items as it was filled with beverages.
reviews.title: Great location, but disappointed overall

reviews.text: I did not feel that the room was very clean. The carpet looked old and worn, and I found a hair on the remote control and several on the bathroom floor. The lotion we got was partially used and was not replaced the next day, nor were the soaps. These are simple things that should not be happening in the first place given the caliber of this hotel. Though I am a President’s Club member, I will likely be staying elsewhere on my next trip to Seattle.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, good location, child friendly

reviews.text: We stayed with young kinds (9 & 6) and from t checkin at the front desk to dinner at Schukers to checkout we were treated very well. The kid size robes in the room were a very nice touch including milk and cookies at night. Hotel is very clean and staff are friendly. Self parking is a breeze (and a bit cheaper) and make sure to get the kids menu at schukers. Only area of improvement would be to have the pool stay open longer than 9pm.
reviews.title: Big name for average hotel

reviews.text: The facade of the entrance to the Fairmont Olympic Hotel is quite impressive and you expect a first class hotel. At the entrance there are some nicely dressed guys waiting to open the door for you, but you find out later this is because the doors woudn't open automatically, actually you need quite a bit of push to open it yourself.
reviews.title: Internet charge is ridiculously high and slow.

reviews.text: This hotel has all the old world charm and graciousness that you could ask for - Bellmen, welcoming front desk staff, large rooms and beautiful decor. Some of the lower rooms can be a little noisy but the incredibly comfortable bed makes up for the noise. I have stayed here twice for week long business meetings and both stays were wonderful.
reviews.title: Old world elegance

reviews.text: Decided tosplurge onmy first ever trip to Seattle and glad Iopicked this gem, Theis Grande Old Dame has beenmeticuloously renovated in concept with the period of its' original hey-day. Staff was beyond accommodating and friendly. Concierges and Doormen made many excellent suggestions and even knew the cab fares downto thepenny to the major attractions. We had a huge room and a very updated bathroom and dressing area. Iwas impressed. I doubtI 'll ever stay anywhere else in Seattle.
reviews.title: It doesn't get better than this

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Fairmont was lovely. Very nice room, comfortable bed. The staff are wonderful!! We walked to Pike Place Market for coffee at the original Starbucks, shopping, restaurants, mass transit is convenient. We took the monorail to the space needle for lunch, and could have taken the Metro to and from the airport if we hadn't rented a car. The Fairmont is right in the middle of a great area for a romantic, fun getaway.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: Downsides:
reviews.title: A fantastic experience

reviews.text: 1. Parking is really expensive! If just flying in for a few days you really can use the great public transportation.
reviews.title: Love the Fairmont

reviews.text: I had the pleasure of spending the night and enjoying a great dinner at this wonderful hotel. The staff was great, my room clean and beautiful, and dinner amazing. (I could cut my steak with a butter knife. It melted in my mouth. And the potatoes... Amazing.)
reviews.title: loved this place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was worried about it being an older hotel, but wow! I thought it was amazing, and beautiful.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: Our party all loved our different rooms, and dinners. We all had nothing but positive things to say.
reviews.title: Truly a lovely experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was wonderful stay by all in our party.
reviews.title: Wonderful Experience

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for our honeymoon in December 2012. The Fairmont is right in the middle of downtown, and walking distance from Pike's Place Market. It's a little longer walk to the Seattle Center (Space Needle, Experience Music Project) or a short taxi.
reviews.title: Great location and good service

reviews.text: I have stayed at this hotel twice for conferences, and had great experiences both times. Nothing will top my first stay, several years ago. I arrived in the early morning hours after a grueling, 20 hours long terrible travel day from the east coast which featured not one, but TWO cancelled flights. The receptionist must have felt sorry for me, because even though I was booked in a regular conference-rate room, she gave me THE best suite in the hotel! It was truly amazing. I just returned from another 4-night stay, this time with a roommate and a request for a room with 2 beds. We were upgraded to a very spacious deluxe room and had a large dressing room with two large closets. Beds were very comfortable and the room was spotless. The only problems we encountered were a TV that didn't always get an HD signal, and some problems with splitting our bill between two cards, which were remedied quickly. The location was wonderful, between the conference center and the Market. The Light Rail station is only a block away. Definitely join the Fairmont President's Club before you stay at any Fairmont hotel (free to join), since you get free internet access as part of your membership.
reviews.title: Great hotel in a very convenient location
First-class hotel
reviews.text: The Fairmont Olympic is a first-class hotel in downtown Seattle. The property is maintained beautifully and has excellent amenities. Shuckers restaurant has a wide-selection of local seafood, wine, and beer with good service. Check-in and check-out were very efficient. Would definitely recommend this property.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights in January. Just like other Fairmont's, this hotel doesn't disappoint. We stayed in suite 1026 and it is up to Fairmont expectations. The architecture of the building is very beautiful. Our bed was a little hard for me, I prefer a softer bed. A couple of things that I found strange were that there was no air conditioning and at night it could get very hot, but you can open the windows. The air registers are on the window sills, and at night when you close the curtains it blocked off the air flow, thus getting hot at night. Another thing I was very surprised by was the amount of siren noise. We were here for 4 nights and 3 days and the sirens from fire trucks, ambulances and police never seemed to stop. One of the doormen told me this was not the norm, but they never stopped the whole time we were here.
reviews.title: Great downtown Seattle location
Remember when ...
reviews.text: We come to Seattle a few times a year and haven't stayed here since the early 80s thought we should give it a try once again , was a great idea from the moment we arrived fast friendly greeting from the valet right through to front desk . Rooms are comfortable and very clean . Great location close to every thing Seattle has to offer . This was a fantastic hotel to stay at and will return soon !!!

My company had their annual sales meeting here this week. I was added as a last minute guest to the hotel list. However, you would have never known I was a late addition. I was treated extremely well at all points of my stay. The room was well-appointed: a sitting room with a separate bedroom. The king bed was nice and firm, the nicest bed I have had in a hotel in years. The bathroom was very spacious. Hot water pressure was never a problem. Two flat screen TVs (1 in each room!).
reviews.title: Elegant with a Comfortable Bed

aka: The Fairmont Olympic Seattle Hotel Seattle
description: Footsteps from Seattle’s most exciting attractions, The Fairmont Olympic Hotel combines traditional warmth with 21st century convenience and personalized service. Located in the heart of downtown Seattle, the beautifully historic 450-room hotel blends classic ambiance and Italian renaissance architecture with state-of-the-art amenities, including high-speed wireless Internet access in all guest rooms and public spaces, 24-hour room service, 24-hour concierge, a fully equipped fitness center with indoor swimming pool, and complimentary house car service throughout downtown. Listed on the National Register of Historic Places, The Fairmont Olympic received its 25th consecutive AAA Five Diamond Award in 2009 and is listed on Condé Nast Traveler’s 2004-2008 Gold List.
